articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Monday it was conducting extensive strikes against targets of the Iranian-backed Hezbollah movement in Lebanon, which come amid some of the heaviest cross-border exchanges of fire in nearly a year of conflict.
articles.title: Israeli military says it is striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Keith Coffman
articles.description: Rejecting an insanity defense, a Colorado jury on Monday convicted a man diagnosed with the severe mental disorder schizophrenia of first-degree murder in a 2021 mass shooting at a grocery store in the city of Boulder that killed 10 people including a police officer.
articles.title: Gunman who killed 10 at Colorado supermarket in 2021 convicted of murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Canadian man detained by China for more than 1,000 days said he was put into solitary confinement for months and interrogated for up to nine hours every day, treatment he said amounted to psychological torture.
articles.title: Canadian detained by China says he experienced psychological torture

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo urged Israel to extend its banking relationships with Palestinian banks for at least a year to avert an economic crisis in the West Bank, warning that Israel's own security was at stake.
articles.title: US urges Israel to extend banking relations with Palestinian banks for at least a year

articles.author: Farah Master
articles.description: China's move to raise retirement ages is a starting point to plug gaping pension deficits and bolster a shrinking workforce but more pain lies ahead as the economy slows, making further reforms urgent, say economists and demographers.
articles.title: China's retirement age reforms not enough to fix pension headache

articles.author: Phil Stewart
articles.description: The United States is sending a small number of additional troops to the Middle East given escalating tensions between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah, the Pentagon said on Monday, declining to specify the precise number or mission of the deployed forces.
articles.title: US sends additional forces to Middle East as tensions soar, Pentagon says

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: The man accused of hiding out with a gun near Donald Trump's Florida golf course in an apparent attempt to assassinate the former U.S. president is due in court on Monday, where prosecutors will argue to keep him in jail until his trial.
articles.title: Trump attempted assassination suspect Ryan Routh to appear in court

articles.author: Monica Machicao
articles.description: Wildfires in Bolivia are now running on a track to set an all-time record, latest satellite data show, with fire hot-spots to-date overtaking the rate in the same period during major blazes in 2010 as the wider South American region burns.
articles.title: Bolivia wildfires set to blaze past record as forests burn

articles.author: Don Durfee, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Israel wants to drag the Middle East into a full-blown war by provoking Iran to join the nearly year-old conflict between Israel and Tehran-backed Hezbollah in Lebanon, Iranian President said on Monday, warning of its "irreversible" consequences.
articles.title: Iran president warns of 'irreversible' consequences of wider regional war

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will set out a "victory plan" to his closest ally this week, in an urgent attempt to influence White House policy on Ukraine's war with Russia no matter who wins the November U.S. elections.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy heads to US with 'victory plan' at perilous moment
